definition: a noisy fight, pleat or gather into a ruffle
details:
noun
- a noisy fight
= synonyms: disturbance
- a high tight collar
= synonyms: ruff, choker, neck ruff
- a strip of pleated material used as a decoration or a trim
= synonyms: flounce
verb
- pleat or gather into a ruffle
= example: pleat or gather into a ruffle
= synonyms: pleat
- disturb the smoothness of
= example: disturb the smoothness of
= synonyms: mess up, rumple, ruffle up
- erect or fluff up
= example: erect or fluff up
= synonyms: fluff
- mix so as to make a random order or arrangement
= synonyms: shuffle
- twitch or flutter
= synonyms: riffle
- trouble or vex
= example: trouble or vex
- discompose
= example: discompose
- to walk with a lofty proud gait, often in an attempt to impress others
= synonyms: strut
- stir up (water) so as to form ripples
= synonyms: riffle
